column4: does anyone know how to get around a server which cannot install 8.04.01 Server?  I am getting an error after hanging at, "Retrieving binutils-static-udeb    2%" and I've found the bug report but no fixes.  I need 8.04 for a client's project.
Was it the bug report that was linked earlier? The fixes I saw involved plugging in a different cd-rom drive and using that to install Ubuntu to the server
KTorrent is great IMHO, but I liked Deluge when I used it a few times
yeah that was it :(  The server is in a rack and no easy access, and I don't know if we have a PCI card or if it has an available slot.
If you don't have any sort of physical access that's not really any fun, you could maybe make a bootable USB pen drive and install from there
i checked, it won't boot from a USB
do you know of a bootable CD that will pass the boot to the usb?
Here at $WORK we do some custom SNMP solutions, and we use customized Ubuntu USB sticks to image the appliances
Hmmm, I don't know, that's a bit tricky... Maybe you could get some sort of a network boot going? It's a tricky problem... Have you tried joining #ubuntu-server ?
I looked into that also but a network boot looks to be a headache and its not wired to our internal network currently...
Sometimes the folks in there are better at helping with these sorts of problems, the really tricky ones here seemed to get drowned out by the constant barrage of wireless/video/audio/p2p questions ;)
in that bug report someone mentioned it working with 'the mini iso' -- do you know what that is?
You could use like, damn small linux, and try to get that booted. Then once you have that booted you could compile/install unetbootin and install Ubuntu via that
